Tucson would not be able to get out of his predicament.  Not this time.  He=
 just accepts Hydra's word, and now realizes that this was not going to be =
the day he would recover Rodimus.  It would have to wait.  Something else h=
ad to be done first.  There would be no battle. He was easilly defeated.

"=
 Perhaps you're right.  Perhaps doing what Perseus had done, was the right =
thing.  And realizing that I am no match for you. I give up.  You are stron=
ger than I am.  And I will leave as you request."

Giving up would be his o=
nly way out of his bind.  That is if Hydras would let him go.  Yet in givin=
g up, he would regroup and think again of how he would actually rescue his =
lost leader.

Ydras:

> "Stop the chit chat you impertinent and foolish Autobot" said H=
ydras while He spat agaisnts Tucson " You the autobots Speakt too much...."=
 Hydras moved aroudn slowly and hissed "He is in our side now, Perseus unde=
rstood that, if he had the half of the courage that the firs autobots had h=
e hadent negociated with us and leave Rodimus at his fate... now is too lat=
e for him and for you"
> 
> With a Sudden movement Hydras trasforfed to hes=
 beast mode, a 5 head hydra. he spread his five heads towards Tuscon grabin=
 with 2 of them Tucson's arms while two more attempred to grabe his legs

>=
 
>   
> Tucson had no idea what was happening to him. Hydras reply comes a=
s a shock to the Autobot, as he gives a blank look all of a sudden. He coul=
d not answer his question without hesitation in his voice.
> 
> " As - as f=
ar as I know, I - I... I - don't think I'm related to him. I deeply admire =
him, yes, but I honestly do not think I'm related to him."
> 
> His deeply =
hidden power of his spark recedes and quickly returns him to his regular he=
ight. He had no notion of how to control it, nor had he known what it was. =
As it reverses, he suddenly feels a good portion of power leave his body, y=
et, he was not about to abandon the act of defending himself against Hydras=
 or Rodimus for that matter. 
> 
> " Power or no power, you've abducted one=
 of my own, and turned him into your evil pawn. No matter the consequence, =
I will stand my ground and do whatever it takes to rightfully return my lea=
der to his role as the commander of the Autobots. Even if I have to saccrif=
ice my own spark to accomplish my mission. That is why I'm here, not for po=
wer, not for lust, not for domination. I'm here because know it or not, som=
eone who was once very close to me, needs my help and I never turn my hand =
away when a fellow comrade is in grave danger. I'm sure you would do the sa=
me for one of your own." 
> 
> He turns to Rodimus. 
> 
> " If I do not suc=
ceed this time, I will suffer my defeat honorably. I will fall many times i=
f I have to. But rest assured Rodimus, when the time is right, and you fina=
lly reach out to me, I promise my hand will be there to reach out to you. A=
nd when I do, I won't let go. I promise, I will not abandon you or this cau=
se. As dark as you are now, you may not understand, but hopefully one day, =
you will." 
> 
> He then turns back to Hydras.
> 
> " All right Hydras, I'l=
l let you decide how you wish to fight. After all, this is your domain, and=
 I am an intruder here. " 
> 
> Deep down Tucson wished he could avoid a sc=
uffle. He wished he could just bargain with Hydras but after seeing that he=
 was a combination of Megatron and Galvatron, that made for a different sit=
uation all together. To him, Decepticons were still his enemies. He was how=
ever still taken aback by Hydra's question. While he looks to Hydras he thi=
nks to himself once more.
> 
> " Me? Related to Optimus Prime?"
>

od up slowly in a non treaten way, and camly walked a round the Scene watch=
ing the battle when Tucson looked like more like Optimus and he said "Yesss=

elation with My old Pal, Optimus Prime?" said hydras with a remarcable iron=
ic mocking tone in the word pal

The battle was not what it seemed . . . 
> > 
> > The punch Rodimus had thr=
own, the one that was so easily blocked by Tuscon, would have shocked Rodim=
us had it landed. He would have been glad to be rid of this annoyance, yes,=
 but it would have been somewhat disappointing as well. 
> > 
> > So when R=
odimus was spun around by Tuscon, the Autobot may have missed the wicked sm=
ile on his face, When Tuscon tried to ram Rodimus into a wall, he may not h=
ave noticed that the sound of crunching metal was not Rodimus' but the rein=
rorced wall shearing and tearing under the force of the assault. It was not=
 the sound of Rodimkus' defeat that resonated through the room, but it was =
something else!
> > 
> > Many of the same teachers that had instructed Tusc=
on had trained a young Hot Rod as well - Jazz, Prowl, Brawn, Kup, even Opti=
mus himself! And while Rodimus no longer clearly remembered all these ones =
and what they had meant to him, thier lessons were still ground into him, a=
nd his reflexes that had been honed over the years of battle! 
> > 
> > Als=
o, this was no young Hot Rod that stood there before them, but a figure sha=
pped by the energy of the matrix into a character of leadership, power and =
ability. He no longer had access to the knowledge and wisdom of the matrix,=
 the energy having been stripped from him. But that power that had been imp=
arted was still there, reconfigured by the power of the predacon shell prog=
ram! He was faster, stronger and far more durable then Hot Rod ever was, he=
 was DARK RODIMUS!
> > 
> > So when Rodimus hit the wall it was not truely =
pain that he felt, but the elation that a true battle was in the making. He=
 felt that charge that all warriors felt when they faced a foe that had som=
e metal! It was an eagerness twisted by Predacon programming into something=
 dark and loathsome. 
> > 
> > So when he stood and turned around it was no=
t defeat in his stance but derision, "So you fancy yourself to be a Prime d=
o you, scrappling?" Rodimus said his tone still mocking as he raised his ar=
m, smiling as his optics glowing with energy, "Well let's see what you got!=
" With a thought he fired a blast of plasma energy from his arm mounted can=
non at this new incarnation of Tuscon, who for the moment appeared to be po=
sturing for Hydras!
> > 
> > OOC: Remember, the matrix that is housed withi=
n Rodimus has no energy of its own, only the housing. It does not have the =
power to reach out and transform anyone, although I do have some ideas. I a=
m not sure if you want to redo your post, or let it go as it stands. 
> >
